tn.text: This is the highest point of Mount Pisgah which is in the northern part of the Abarim mountain range. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:32:48|32:49]].
This is another name for Jericho. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was a town in Moab. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:03:28|3:29]].

tn.ref: look at it with your eyes

tn.text: This refers to the time that this was written or edited, not to the present time in the twenty-first century.

tn.ref: one hundred twenty years old ... thirty days
his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated
tn.text: This means his eyes and body were still strong and healthy.

tn.ref: Joshua ... was full of the spirit of wisdom
tn.text: The writer speaks as if Joshua were a container and the spirit were a physical object that could be put into a container. AT: "Yahweh enabled Joshua ... to be very wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Moses had laid his hands on him
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "Moses had laid his hands on him to set Joshua apart so Joshua would serve Yahweh." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is an idiom. It means Yahweh and Moses had a very close relationship. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
